page.title: 15Grinshill
page.content: Grinshill is an area of great importance in Shropshire for industrial and leisure purposes and although the eastern section of the hill is outside this D block, its influence is of great importance to the village of Clive and the local area. The sandstone of Grinshill is of particularly good quality as building stone and is used in many local buildings as well as at such places as 10, Downing Street and the Bluecoats School, Liverpool. This creamy coloured stone is still quarried at Grinshill. The hill itself is also important as a leisure area with many attractive walks and interesting wildlife and plants. One access to the hill can be gained by walking up a path, of bare stone in places, alongside Clive church.This is also the access to the village school.
